name: MultiCity_Population_Energy_Education_Dataset
description: Combined dataset for analyzing demographic trends, educational attainment, and energy consumption patterns across three major U.S. cities. Includes population estimates from Census Bureau American Community Survey 1-Year Estimates, educational attainment from ACS 5-Year Estimates, and electricity sales data from EIA State Energy Data System.

distribution.description: New York state electricity sales data (all sectors combined)
California state electricity sales data (all sectors combined)
Washington state electricity sales data (all sectors combined)
New York City educational attainment data (weighted average education level in years)
Los Angeles educational attainment data (weighted average education level in years)
Seattle educational attainment data (weighted average education level in years)

processingHistory.methodology: Automated Python scripts using U.S. Census Bureau API for population and education data, and EIA API for energy consumption data. Population data fetched via Census Data API querying American Community Survey (ACS) 1-Year Estimates. Education data fetched via Census Data API querying ACS 5-Year Estimates (Table B15003 - Educational Attainment). Educational attainment calculated as weighted average education level in equivalent years of schooling. Energy data fetched via EIA State Energy Data System API querying electricity retail sales by state. All data parsed from JSON responses and saved to individual CSV files per city.
processingHistory.dataSource: American Community Survey (ACS) 1-Year Estimates (population); American Community Survey (ACS) 5-Year Estimates (education); EIA State Energy Data System (SEDS)
processingHistory.apiVersion: Census Data API; EIA API v2
processingHistory.estimateType: ACS 1-Year Population Estimates; ACS 5-Year Educational Attainment Estimates; Annual Electricity Retail Sales

dataSources.variableDescription: Educational Attainment for the Population 25 Years and Over (High school through Doctorate degree)
dataSources.calculationMethod: Weighted average of education levels using equivalent years of schooling (12-21 years)

dataSources.sourceName: EIA State Energy Data System - Electricity Retail Sales

dataSources.calculationMethod: Weighted average of education levels using equivalent years of schooling (12-21 years)

dataSources.calculationMethod: Weighted average of education levels using equivalent years of schooling (12-21 years)

columns.name: Consumption

columns.name: City
columns.description: City name (New York City, Los Angeles, or Seattle)

columns.name: Education level
columns.description: Weighted average educational attainment in equivalent years of schooling for population 25 years and over
columns.calculationNote: Calculated from ACS Table B15003 variables using weighted average by population count at each education level

columns.name: City
columns.description: City name (New York, Los Angeles, or Seattle)

citation: U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey 1-Year Estimates, 2014-2023 (population); U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates, 2014-2023 (education); U.S. Energy Information Administration, State Energy Data System, 2014-2023
limitations: ACS 1-Year Estimates have margins of error that should be considered for statistical analysis
ACS 5-Year Estimates represent rolling 5-year averages and have ~1 year release lag
Data for the most recent year (2023) may not be available until released by Census Bureau
ACS 1-Year Estimates are only available for areas with populations of 65,000 or more
Annual estimates may not be directly comparable across years due to methodology changes
Energy consumption data represents state-level totals rather than city-specific consumption
Energy data temporal coverage ends at 2023; 2023 data not yet available from EIA
Electricity sales data may not capture all energy consumption (excludes natural gas, heating oil, etc.)
State-level energy data serves as proxy for city-level consumption patterns
Education data uses simplified weighting scheme (12-21 years) which may not capture full complexity of educational attainment
Education level is calculated as weighted average and may not reflect distribution of education levels within each city
2024 ACS 5-Year data (2020-2024 period) not yet released as of October 2025
